issue.title: Add KAT checks to master-new-api following nist-branch approach
Udpade qtesla with new 08-27-2018 package
issue.body: qtesla team updated their library (announcement: https://groups.google.com/a/list.nist.gov/forum/#!topic/pqc-forum/2IJF-gt2Gc4); update the oqs code.

issue.title: Add Titanium algorithm to nist-branch
issue.body:
Original submission:
http://users.monash.edu.au/~rste/Titanium.html
https://github.com/raykzhao/Titanium

Titanium-CCA should be incorporated in the following strengths:
Std128
Med160
Hi192
Super256

issue.title: Error running make on master
issue.body:
Hi,

After cloning the repository and building the code with make as shown in the Readme, I get the following error:

vagrant@ubuntu-xenial:/home/Shared_Folder/liboqs$ make
/bin/mkdir -p include/oqs
cp -f config.h include/oqs
cp -f src/oqs.h include/oqs
cp -f src/common/common.h include/oqs
cp -f src/common/rand.h include/oqs
cp -f src/crypto/aes/aes.h include/oqs
cp -f src/crypto/rand_urandom_aesctr/rand_urandom_aesctr.h include/oqs
cp -f src/crypto/rand_urandom_chacha20/rand_urandom_chacha20.h include/oqs
cp -f src/crypto/sha3/sha3.h include/oqs
cp -f src/kem/kem.h include/oqs
cp -f src/kem/bike/kem_bike.h include/oqs
cp -f src/kem/frodokem/kem_frodokem.h include/oqs
cp -f src/kem/sike/kem_sike.h include/oqs
cp -f src/kex/kex.h include/oqs
cp -f src/kex_ntru/kex_ntru.h include/oqs
cp -f src/kex_rlwe_newhope/kex_rlwe_newhope.h include/oqs
cp -f src/kex_sidh_msr/kex_sidh_msr.h include/oqs
cp -f src/sig/sig.h include/oqs
cp -f src/sig_picnic/sig_picnic.h include/oqs
cp -f src/sig_qtesla/sig_qtesla.h include/oqs
cp -pR -f .libs/liboqs.a
cp: missing destination file operand after '.libs/liboqs.a'
Try 'cp --help' for more information.
Makefile:1144: recipe for target 'links' failed
make: *** [links] Error 1

I've tried different configurations, and different branches, but I always get the same error. I kind of think I'm missing something here, however I just want to use the library with mc_bits enabled, and that didn'T work as well, so I tried the standard build instead. Same problem.

Thanks in advance

comment.body:
Can you try the fix I've created on the following branch:
- `git clone -b master-dont-link-liboqs git@github.com:open-quantum-safe/liboqs.git`
- or download https://github.com/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/archive/master-dont-link-liboqs.zip

issue.title: KAT checks not working right on master
issue.body:
There are several problems with the recently merged KAT checks on master:

1. Building on macOS without OpenSSL yields the following error.  This is because rand\_nist.c depends on OpenSSL, but we should be able to build liboqs master without OpenSSL.  So we need to selectively disable all relevant parts (rand\_nist, kat\_kem) when OpenSSL is not present.  Or we need to decide to require OpenSSL -- which would be something for discussion.

```
rand_nist.c:12:10: fatal error: 'openssl/conf.h' file not found
#include <openssl/conf.h>
         ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
1 error generated.
```

2. Several of the Travis build logs are showing error messages despite passing.  So there are actually two problems to fix here: (a) figure out why there are KAT errors in the logs and fix them, and (b) figure out why the Travis tests aren't failing due to the errors.  See:
    - https://travis-ci.org/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/jobs/424519384
    - https://travis-ci.org/open-quantum-safe/liboqs/jobs/424519385

comment.body:
The problem is that rand\_nist.c calls OpenSSL's AES 256 implementation via the OpenSSL EVP API.  We don't have AES 256 in our src/crypto/aes.h implementation.  

So our options are:

1. Make OpenSSL mandatory.
2. Refactor the build so rand\_nist.c and kat\_kem are not built when OpenSSL is not used.
3. Add AES 256 without OpenSSL.

3 seems like the proper choice -- and it will also allow us to build KATs on Windows.

To do 3, we need to:

- [ ] Implement AES-256 in src/crypto/aes* => Douglas
- [ ] Change rand\_nist.c's `AES256_ECB` function to call OQS AES 256 and remove OpenSSL includes etc. in this file => Shravan
- [ ] Remove `USE_OPENSSL` from around all randombytes\_nist\_kat and related stuff in src/common/rand.c => Shravan
- [ ] See if that makes it build on macOS without OpenSSL enabled => Shravan
- [ ] Add a Travis test for build on macOS without OpenSSL enabled => Shravan
- [ ] Add rand\_nist.c to VisualStudio build => Shravan, Christian
- [ ] Add kat\_kem to VisualStudio build => Christian
- [ ] Add test script to AppVeyor that checks KATs => Christian

issue.title: Remove kex_rlwe_newhope
issue.body: As we have fewer KEX algorithms left, minimal\_kex\_oqs has to be updated (and also becomes less necessary?).  It is currently causing the Windows build to fail.  @christianpaquin Do you think it's worth investigating, or should we just remove minimal\_kex\_oqs from the Windows build since all the KEXes will go away over the next month or so?

comment.body: This could be resolved by point minimal\_kex\_oqs to use SIDH rather than NTRU because SIDH is available on Windows.

issue.title: Remove kex_rlwe_newhope

It is currently causing the Windows build to fail.  @christianpaquin Do you think it's worth investigating, or should we just remove minimal\_kex\_oqs from the Windows build since all the KEXes will go away over the next month or so?

comment.body: I'll do this today, never mind @christianpaquin.

issue.title: Add shared library support and test
issue.body: Added shared library support and linking tests.

comment.body: Obsolete; new pull to be created.

issue.title: Add shared library build to testing system
issue.body: On nist-branch we build `test_kem` (which statically links against liboqs.a) and `test_kem_shared` (which dynamically links against liboqs.so) and test both of them in Travis.  Is there a way to do that on master branch?
